description.p: A data object is a POJO Java data object. It will have getter and setter methods for all attributes defined, along with private instance variables for those attributes. Attributes may be of any type that have been processed by the time this data object has been processed.

The name of the data object to define, usually in upper camel format such as "DataObject". This will become both the name of the data object class and the name of the type as referred to by other component definitions.

A comma-separated list of attributes that this data object will have. For each attribute, the data object class will have a private member, a getter method and a setter method. The attributes may be of any type that has already been defined.
Each attribute is specified as "<name>:</type>" where the type is optional if "name" is already a system attribute.
The package in which the Java file will be placed, under the package root of the application as defined for Java language support.

output.p: A Java data object with getters and setters for the attributes defined in the 'attributes' XML attribute.

longExplanation.p: The generated data object is located in a package as specified by the Data Object pkg configuration property as well as the Java root package as defined by Java language support.

example.desc: A typical data object with attribute types specified.

exampleComp.div:
(Where generator.xml has build root defined as "c:\build")
<dataObject xmlns="http://javascribe.sf.net/patterns/data-object" name="UserInfo" attributes="firstName:string,lastName:string,accountInfo:AccountInfo">
<c:property xmlns:c="http://javascribe.sf.net/config" name="net.sf.javascribe.langsupport.java.rootDir">java</c:property>
<c:property name="net.sf.javascribe.langsupport.java.rootPkg">net.sf.javascribe.example</c:property>
<c:property name="net.sf.javascribe.patterns.dataobject.DataObject.pkg">dataobj</c:property>
</dataObject>

explanation.p: This data object has three attributes: firstName, lastName and accountInfo. For this to be valid, AccountInfo must be a valid type in the system (Perhaps a previously defined data object).

systemAttribute.name: userInfoList
systemAttribute.desc: A java.util.List<UserInfo> (with UserInfo as the element type)

file.name: c:\build\java\net\sf\javascribe\example\dataobj\UserInfo.java
file.p: The Java file for the UserInfo class. It will have private member variables and "public void setFirstName(String firstName)" along with "public String getFirstName()".

The package is defined by Java Support's root package, along with the property "net.sf.javascribe.patterns.dataobject.DataObject.pkg". The file is placed in a directory defined by the properties specified in the example.
Note: Normally you want to define properties for the root package and Java root directory in generator.xml.
